subject: Travel
title: Gertrude Bell: Queen of the Desert
description: A micro-lesson that makes Gertrude Bell: Queen of the Desert usable.

hook.text: In 1900, an English woman rode a camel into the Arabian desert. She mapped it better than any man.

buildup.text: Gertrude Bell learned Arabic, befriended tribal leaders, and traveled where Europeans feared to go.

discovery.text: During World War I, British intelligence relied on her maps and contacts more than any spy.

twist.text: After the war, she drew the borders of modern Iraq. She chose its first king.

climax.text: T.E. Lawrence (Lawrence of Arabia) admitted she knew the desert better than he ever did.

punchline.text: She drew a nation's borders from a camel's back.

quiz.question: What country's borders did Gertrude Bell help draw?
